plugins.description:
Vue project generator plugin for Figma


Instructions:

Use the utility classes to insure Vigma captures the design accurately, those classes can be applied by including them in Figma layers names.


  • Flex properties
  • row: To apply  display: flex; on a group.
  • h-center: To center the children horizontally.
  • v-center: To center the children vertically.
  • Columns
  • col: To mark a group as a column.
  • value: The col property takes a value to apply width for the column, values are 1-12
  • Buttons
  • button: To mark a group as a button.
  • ButtonText: A button group should contain a Figma text inside it, it will be converted into a paragraph element.
  • ButtonBackground: A button group should contain a Figma rectangle inside it, the generated button element will take its style from this rectangle.


Example: The following is an example of how we can use those classes with Figma layers.

  • GroupName: row, v-center, h-center
  • SubGroupName: cols-6
  • ButtonName: button
  • ButtonText
  • ButtonBackground
  • SubGroupName: cols-6
  • Text

The above tree will then be converted into this code:


             

<div class="GroupName">
    <div class="cols-6">
        <p class="TextName">Text content here</p>
    </div>
    <div class="cols-6">
        <button class="ButtonName">
           <p class="TextName">Button text content here</p>
        </button>
    </div>
</div>

plugins.description:
Bring excitement back to virtual collaboration with video messaging


The Vimeo Record plugin allows you to record your screen, webcam, or both directly from the files youâ€™re collaborating on in Figma and FigJam. This means that you can spend less time typing out your feedback, and more time capturing ideas right as inspiration strikes.


To leave live feedback in FigJam, simply record your comments in the file of choice, then watch your video preview unfurl alongside your work. When working on a project in Figma Design, you can embed your video as a thumbnail directly on the Figma canvas. Your collaborators can then watch your comments, ideas, or accolades via simple playback within your whiteboard or canvas.


Hereâ€™s how your team can use Vimeo Record to work better together:


  • Project onboarding: Record a short welcome video to review goals, progress, and next steps so new team members can get up to speed quickly without the need for another meeting or lengthy email.
  • Design feedback: Highlight specific visual elements while narrating your feedback to keep your ideas in context.
  • Async ideation: Share your ideas at the moment inspiration strikes to add more engaging context to your projects -- then let your team watch and respond with comments when itâ€™s convenient for them.


How to get started:

  1. Download the Vimeo Record plugin
  2. Connect Vimeo to your Figma account
  3. Select recording modes
  4. Create your video
  5. Add video to canvas or share link to it with your team
  6. Check this How-to article for more details
  7. Install Vimeo Record Chrome Extension to record videos wherever you go

plugins.description:
Visible Property 2 will let you name your layer to control value. It will update texts following reference's properties whenever you call the plugin.


Youtube: https://youtu.be/NoihOB1Z6qM


ğŸ· How it works:


  1. Define reference element by adding "#" in front of a layer name. For example, "#color"
  2. Defile text element you want to update (#reference + . + method). For example, "#color.fill", "#color.fillRGB", "#color.height" etc.
  3. Call the plugin by typing "cmd + /" -> "visible property 2"


ğŸ¯ Tips


You can refer to the parent layer by using "##Parent" or "##TopParent" without inserting a layer name.

For example,

  • ##Parent.name or ##Parent.fill
  • ##TopParent.name or ##TopParent.fill


ğŸ¦ Properties:


Fill

  • fill -> #123456 78%
  • fillRGB -> rgba(123, 456, 789, 1)
  • fillHSL -> hsla(123, 456, 789, 0.1)
  • fillHSB -> hsba(123, 456, 789, 0.1)
  • fillStyle -> DarkBlue
  • fillStyleDescription -> The Description


Stroke

  • stroke -> #123456
  • strokeRGB -> rgba(123, 456, 789, 1)
  • strokeHSL -> hsla(123, 456, 789, 0.1)
  • strokeHSB -> hsba(123, 456, 789, 0.1)
  • strokeStyle -> DarkBlue
  • strokeStyleDescription -> The Description


Text

  • font -> Roboto
  • fontWeight -> Bold
  • fontSize -> 12
  • paragraphIndent -> 12
  • paragraphSpace -> 12
  • letterSpace -> 12 or 12%
  • lineHeight -> 12 or 12%
  • textStyle -> Body
  • textStyleDescription -> The Description


Size

  • height -> 32
  • width -> 64


Layer

  • name -> layer name


Component

  • description -> component description


Note: This plugin only supports gradients with default Start/Stop positions

This plugin is an open-source on github

plugins.description:
Find the visual center of any vector shape.


The plugin uses two methods for determining the visual center depending on the shape.


  1. For triangles the plugin will find the centroid to determine visual center.
  2. For vector shapes with more than three vertices the plugin uses the center of the smallest enclosing circle (https://www.nayuki.io/page/smallest-enclosing-circle).


ğŸ‘‰ Usage


  1. Select one or more vector shapes and run the plugin
  2. A guide layer will be added to the page and grouped together with the selected shape.


ğŸ‘‰ Supported Node Types


  • VECTOR
  • STAR
  • RECTANGLE
  • POLYGON
  • ELLIPSE


ğŸ¤” Edge cases


This plugin is not a bulletproof solution to finding the exact visual center. There are still cases in which manual alignment is necessary.

plugins.description:
Compare snapshots of Figma objects to visually compare later as those objects change.


This Figma plug enables you to add and manage snapshots per Figma page using the Visual Difference dialog. Per comparison, you can:


  • Compare baseline and latest versions side by side
  • Quickly switch between the comparison and the original artwork to adjust
  • Quickly visualize which snapshots have differences and which do not
  • Identify when the snapshot was taken and the last time comparisons were run
  • Highlight differences by a scalably transparent overlay or fun party mode
  • Approve of detected differences to replace a baseline snapshot


Building upon how Figma enables you to compare visual differences in a branch of the main file, you can use this plugin to:


  • Conduct visual regression prior to or independent of Figma branching
  • Run comparisons for single objects independently
  • Detect differences caused by updating library assets
  • Inspect and adjust objects rapidly while comparing
  • Discover subtle differences in page mockups


Made by @kevinmpowell and @nathanacurtis of EightShapes LLC.

Join the top brands and agencies using Vizard to scale their creatives.


âœ… Handoff âœ… Personalization at scale âœ… Creative Automation


Designers

Look, we know your time is precious!

You don't enjoy talking to the marketing fellas, do you? They want you to center-align a triangle in a circle; they don't really know what a visual center is!


Vizard lets you keep control of design guidelines while saving you all the time of going back & forth with marketers.


You already handled the developers with Figma/Zeplin, good job! ğŸ‘ Marketers are your mile. This is your true fire & forget!


Features

  • Handoff designs to other stakeholders while keeping your Figma designs intact
  • Seamlessly collaborate with marketers
  • Save your precious time by doing things ONCE!


Now, please skip the next section. Promise?


Marketers

Here is our little secret - We really made Vizard for you! Sssshhh..! We are giving you control to own your assets & the freedom to make unlimited versions of them without bothering the designers. No need to learn a design software & yet be able to generate thousands of variations on-brand!

How to use

  1. Sign-up on https://studio.vizardapps.com
  2. Install Vizard Figma Plugin
  3. Select one or more Frames that you would like to share with the marketing team, run the plugin
  4. (First time only) Click on 'Connect Vizard'. It will open authorization page in browser. Click on 'Authorize Figma'
  5. If the preview looks good, click 'Send to Vizard'. That's it!

Known issues

  • Figma Arrow elements get imported as straight lines
  • Only outside stroke is supported. Inside & center strokes get converted to outside strokes


For questions & suggestions, please reach out to us at hello@vizardapps.com

plugins.name: VKUI Toolkit

plugins.description:
Create voting boxes for your designs. Once created, you can vote on your designs via a button in the sidebar.



How do I vote?

1. Select the nodes to vote on.

2. Run the plugin.

3. Style the boxes to your taste.

4. Select the nodes or boxes and vote via the sidebar.


Who can vote?

Anyone who has write access to your document. Users with read-only access unfortunately cannot vote.


Can I vote from presentation view or put a link into my presentation?

Unfortunately not (yet).


What if someone removes the plugin-section from the sidebar or deletes the box?

You can simply run the plugin on the original node again. The voting score will be recovered.


What will users that don't have the plugin installed see?

Users still see a plugin section in the sidebar, stating 'Install vote'
plugins.name: vote

plugins.description:
Easily track changes across your entire Figma file and avoid accidentally breaking something.


Step 1: Snapshot your current file

The first thing you'll want to do is set your baseline. This will go through all of your pages and create snapshot images for each of them. If your file has many pages, you can select or deselect individual pages.


Step 2: Go make some changes

Once you've got your baseline snapshots set, go forth and make some changes. For example, you may be curious what will happen if you change a specific color. When you're finished, click 'Take Snapshot'


Step 3: Compare Results

At a glance, pages that have any visually noticeable changes will be shown as failed. The baseline snapshot is compared against the comparision snapshot to produce a diff image. Any changes will be marked red.


------------------------------------


Completely open source.

  •  Configurable â€• Wantedly Preflight has 6+ sophisticated rule and all of them are well-tested. However, in case if you would like to opt-out of some of the rule in your project, you can independently configure items to enable.
  •  Ignore â€• Exceptions are always there. On the result page, you have a check button to ignore the specific node. After you ignored a node, it will always be considered appropriate regardless of whether it violates our rules or not.


Our Design System

See Wantedly UI Components

plugins.description:
Create & manage your team's webhooks.


E.g. have file updates notify you in Slack by triggering your workflows or send updates to custom endpoints.


(Note: to create a webhook for your team, the team needs be on a professional plan in Figma.)


You can...

  • create webhooks for teams
  • view a list of webhooks for your teams
  • remove webhooks
  • view past (restricted to one week) calls made to the webhook from Figma.


Requirements

  • To manage a team's webhooks you need to be at least an administrator for that team & that team needs to be on a professional plan.
  • You need to have a "Personal Access Token" (within Figma go to your avatar -> settings)
  • The team ID of the team for which to manage webhooks (currently only accessible from the browser version)


Notes

  • This plugin will receive more features/updates.
  • Webhooks are currently in Beta.
  • I'm not a designer myself. So pardon me for the horrible cover art/icon ğŸ˜…


Having feedback or questions? Just let me know ğŸ™‚


==FAQ==


Where do i find my Team ID's?

  1. Open your browser and navigate to Figma.
  2. On the left side select the team (click on it's name; don't select a project)
  3. In the browser's URL bar you can find the Team ID. It is right behind "...team/". E.g. https://www.figma.com/files/team/1234567890/xxx?fuid=8934... => Team ID is 1234567890


I can't create webhooks. What to do?

  • Please check if your team is on a professional plan.


How can i check if my team has a Pro plan?

  1. In Figma select click on your team name (not on one of it's projects).
  2. If the "Billing" tab appears near "Settings" you can check that or check "Settings" -> "Plan and billing"

plugins.description:
Wordsvil.com is made to help you and your team to organize, translate and update all text in your app and across different departments. Keep everyone on the same page.


  • Upload your text file (.csv, .json), or create it directly from your Figma file
  • Invite team members to join you in Figma or on the webapp to work with you
  • Update and sync your files through the plugin or webapp, add new languages, ensure everyone is on the same page. 
  • Export for end-products in .csv and .json. (directly API coming soon) 


How it works: 

Wordsvil.com connects your Figma text objects with your apps text files. The Figma object name will be synced with the text keys, to keep both text values the same.


  • Install the plugin, or log into the website and set up an account
  • Add a new project and use â€œfrom Figma pageâ€ if you want to start from your Figma files, or utilize the other option to start from scratch, from csv or json files. 
  • After the project is created, the plugin/webapp serves as the source of truth. 
  • Within the project, click on the menu and select Team to add collaborators to a project.


For csv follow this format. Example: 

key,notes,en,de 
welcome,,Welcome!,Willkommen!


For json follow this format. Example: 

{ "EN": { "welcome": "Welcome!",  â€œbuyâ€: â€Buy nowâ€ },
  "DE": { "welcome": "Willkommen!", â€œbuyâ€: â€Kauenâ€  }}

copy, content, text, strings, writing, localization, language, translation, words, sync, translate

Padding and Spacing Panel

Catch up with your team instantly ğŸ‰ with the Yasou plugin through video calls.

Here is your first ever ğŸ¥‡ Figma plugin to do video calls with all those interacting into the same Figma file. The Yasou plugin, enables teams that work together on a file to do audio or video calls and run workshops efficiently. Suitable for rapid team communication, share screening, instant feedback and workshops. ğŸ¤™ğŸ¿

Instructions - How to use the Plugin:

Just one from your team has to initiate the plugin:
      1. Install the plugin.
      2. Run the plugin
      3. Enter meeting name and click OK

All the other users in the file like other editors, owners, admins and viewers will then see a generated Image inside the Figma file.
For each one to join the call:

      1. Select the generated image
      2. Join the call by Clicking the Plugin at the bottom right side of Figma.
      3. Enjoy.

Disclaimer: This project is open source and a proof of concept. We are not really sure if it is useful, so we need your opinion. Use it and help us make Yassu even better or hit just us with the hard truth and tell us to drop it.

To give feedback for this plugin, please use this google form right here, anonymously: https://forms.gle/ak7Ki5FBHpnJeHDw8

Learn more about us: www.quintessential.gr
Read our blog: https://medium.com/quintessential-sft
GitHub code: https://github.com/Quintessential-SFT/Yasou-Figma
plugins.name: Yasou - Team Video Calls

plugins.description:
Create, switch and manage as many themes as you need.

Global themes supported, with no need to login anywhere.

Export CSS-variables from theme.

Update all styles within theme at once using Palettes.


Learn how to use this plugin with this Figma Yellowstone Playground


Switch themes ğŸŒğŸŒ›

Plugin switches all colors and effects within selection.

Works for texts with multiple styles.


Create new themes â€” as much as you need ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ¨ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ¨

Duplicate existing theme to create new in just one click. No need to create new styles manually.


Manage themes: rename, update, delete ğŸ§°ğŸ¨

Update themes using Palettes: draw themeâ€™s Palette, change its colors and effects and update entire theme. Try this Figma Yellowstone Playground to learn how to use it.


Use global themes ğŸ“–

Save your libraryâ€™s themes within plugin, load it in another figma file and use. That easy. No need to login anywhere, no need to create any external files or smth.


Export CSS-variables from theme ğŸ“¤

Put css-variables in styles Description once and get ready-to-go code in one click, with any update of your theme.


---


What it does with Local Styles ğŸ’¡

Plugin puts square brackets in style name, to define what theme it belongs to. For example: [Light] / card, [Dark] / card or [Gray] / card.


Of course you can put brackets manually, anywhere, there's no limits: Card [Light], Card / bg [Light], Card [Light] / bg, [Light] / bg â€” its all good. Also, plugin will keep your syntax renaming themes and creating new ones.

plugins.name: ZapBG

plugins.description:
Zebra is a lightweight APCA colour contrast checker.


What is APCA?

APCA(Advanced Perceptual Contrast Algorithm) is a modern color contrast algorithm that aims to be be perceptually uniform. It is currently being evaluated as a part of the WCAG 3 draught process.


Note: Because APCA is still being evaluated, it is likely that some aspects of the algorithm and scoring system will change between APCA versions.


More info here


Using the plugin

You can change the input colors manually using the text inputs or you can use selection mode.


Selection mode lets you select colors by clicking around your document. To toggle selection mode, click the icons above the text inputs.


Font Size Table

Shows the preferred font size for each font weight at the current contrast level.


Comparison Table

Compares the APCA contrast to WCAG 2


Info

More info on what exactly each APCA level means.



V1.0

If you are looking for the v1.0 tutorial, you can find that here:

https://medium.com/@danhollick/figma-plugin-tutorial-1-6-65fc2102506

or here:

https://alcohollick.com/writing/figma-plugin-tutorial-1-6/


Bugs? Suggestions?

Zebra is completely open source and the repo is here. Feel free to make an issue or start a discussion.
plugins.name: zebra

plugins.description:
Create customized striped backgrounds in Figma with ease. Zebra lets you design loading bars, inaccessible zones, and much more with few clicks!


Functionalities

  • Two-color striped background creation
  • Angle input for stripes pointing to any direction
  • Width & Height input to adjust the background's size
  • Stripes width input to adjust the stripes width
  • Only a portion of the striped background is visible. If you need to adjust the offset of the stripes, just unlock the background and drag it inside the outer frame.


Future plans

  • Multiple-colored stripes
  • Adjusting the width of individual stripes


Contact

This project is completely open-sourced if you want to see the codebase and help me implement new features, see the GitHub repository. If you have issues with the plugin, create a GitHub issue ğŸ˜‰
plugins.name: Zebra - Striped backgrounds

plugins.description:
Join thousands of users who use Figma and Zeplin together


Stay in design flow, publish finalized designs for development

Go further than specs by publishing finalized designs right from Figma. Developers get locked designs to build from, and you always have control of when versions are published.


A limitless canvas designers love, the structured workspace the team needs

Zeplin is an organized workspace that is friendly to the entire product team. Sections and Tags help the team easily understand designs, no need for extra documentation or design tool training.


Take your design system further than ever before

Extend your design system into the developer world with Zeplin. Showcase reusable components, including Figma Variants. Then, watch them go even further by connecting components to code.


Zeplin provides a design workspace that helps teams deliver on the promise of design. Itâ€™s easy to publish finalized designs, and teams always have clarity on exactly what to build. Collaborating on designs is entirely different in Zeplin, which is accessible & friendly to users without design backgrounds. Scale your design system into the developer world and connect component to code, all with Zeplin.


TO GET STARTED:

  1. Register for a Zeplin account: https://app.zeplin.io/signup 
  2. Download the apps here: https://zpl.io/download-apps
  3. Watch our demo video and publish your first design to Zeplin today! 


ğŸ“š Resources

  • Get Started with Figma Plugin
  • Figma Plugin Troubleshooting Guide


Check out the Design Delivery with Zeplin file for a guided walkthrough, plus tips and tricks to optimize your workflow.


If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to us at support@zeplin.io.
plugins.name: Zeplin

plugins.description:
Easily create, convert or wrap layers in zero frames.


Add zero frame: Add a zero frame to selected frames and auto layouts, or if nothing is selected, the canvas.


Convert to zero frame: Convert selected frames and auto layouts to zero frames while retaining their positioning properties.


Wrap in zero frame: Wrap selected layers in a zero frame.


What and Why?

A zero frame is a frame with either zero height or zero width. It occupies no space on the canvas but can position layers within in.


Zero frames are often used to add layers to auto layouts with absolute positioning i.e. they are not affected by the stacking order of other layers in the auto layout. Some novel uses of zero frames are detailed in this great talk from Figma Config 2021 - Pushing Figma to its limits with Chudo, Andrei, Gleb, Vitalii, Shuaiqi.


Open Source

Zero Frame is open source and contributions are welcome.
plugins.name: Zero Frame

plugins.description: Organize your canvas to start at x=0 and y=0
